boundary="--==_mimepart_5988aa02f1656_43c73fc0fd359c303321b3"; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit Precedence: list X-GitHub-Sender: jrbtaylor X-GitHub-Recipient: Mazecreator X-GitHub-Reason: subscribed List-ID: tensorflow/tensorflow <tensorflow.tensorflow.github.com> List-Archive: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow List-Post: <mailto:reply@reply.github.com> List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:unsub+0118f3a063414c5212a6078372bf55886f5b2cd72f9175e692cf0000000115a06c0292a169ce0ecf945f@reply.github.com>, <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/ARjzoEmFZkGuMX4w59qZPYgNfWjUxNSMks5sV1ACgaJpZM4OvwAD> X-Auto-Response-Suppress: All X-GitHub-Recipient-Address: mazecreator@mazecreator.com X-SG-EID: BJ4qYjf5a3yL0lCrdDNghY4YYR+k1a+cluU6wEX1JqyrUTrsHGEsw3btqicPDe7W58SJ1M1LpZOhvc s399Ilj8f4ZNxb5kuo+3HpHYGxW6XbRpzhOQxtN80WqIpeSpvND2ZXxBrl/neQE3pfHCkqlhFL7GFL mdyrnn6EmFeFiOIbA6d1OcyLqdrJwQTm2ogU88gf9GefOEPwSyf4zibZYhIubyMaEiCSsm6U0VnDu9 A= X-Spam-Status: No, score= X-Spam-Score: X-Spam-Bar: X-Ham-Report: X-Spam-Flag: NO
----==_mimepart_5988aa02f1656_43c73fc0fd359c303321b3 Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit I'm using tf.contrib.data for my input pipeline. Since it feeds the model without placeholders, I need to be able to reload both the model and input pipeline in order to resume training later. However, the make_initializer method of tf.contrib.data.Iterator does not have a name argument like most (all?) other Tensorflow operations, making it impossible (or at best, error-prone) to find these ops in the reloaded graph. Unless I'm mistaken, this seems like a standard use-case and the missing name argument is inconsistent with the rest of Tensorflow.
-- You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub: #12083 ----==_mimepart_5988aa02f1656_43c73fc0fd359c303321b3 Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit <p>I'm using tf.contrib.data for my input pipeline. Since it feeds the model without placeholders, I need to be able to reload both the model and input pipeline in order to resume training later. However, the make_initializer method of tf.contrib.data.Iterator does not have a name argument like most (all?) other Tensorflow operations, making it impossible (or at best, error-prone) to find these ops in the reloaded graph. Unless I'm mistaken, this seems like a standard use-case and the missing name argument is inconsistent with the rest of Tensorflow.</p> <p style="font-size:small;-webkit-text-size-adjust:none;color:#666;">—<br />You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.<br />Reply to this email directly, <a href="#12083">view it on GitHub</a>, or <a href="https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ARjzoGyU1Z0R5mBKSwbbmSIjVc8hxmhwks5sV1ACgaJpZM4OvwAD">mute the thread</a>.<img alt="" height="1" src="https://github.com/notifications/beacon/ARjzoCvYsW95XN5aYu1_tVPIK8l8pPGxks5sV1ACgaJpZM4OvwAD.gif" width="1" /></p> <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/EmailMessage"> <div itemprop="action" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/ViewAction"> <link itemprop="url" href="#12083"></link> <meta itemprop="name" content="View Issue"></meta> </div> <meta itemprop="description" content="View this Issue on GitHub"></meta> </div> <script type="application/json" data-scope="inboxmarkup">{"api_version":"1.0","publisher":{"api_key":"05dde50f1d1a384dd78767c55493e4bb","name":"GitHub"},"entity":{"external_key":"github/tensorflow/tensorflow","title":"tensorflow/tensorflow","subtitle":"GitHub repository","main_image_url":"https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/143418/17495839/a5054eac-5d88-11e6-95fc-7290892c7bb5.png","avatar_image_url":"https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/143418/15842166/7c72db34-2c0b-11e6-9aed-b52498112777.png","action":{"name":"Open in GitHub","url":"https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow"}},"updates":{"snippets":[{"icon":"DESCRIPTION","message":"tf.contrib.data.Iterator.make_initializer operation lacks name (#12083)"}],"action":{"name":"View Issue","url":"#12083"}}}</script> ----==_mimepart_5988aa02f1656_43c73fc0fd359c303321b3--

I'm using tf.contrib.data for my input pipeline. Since it feeds the model without placeholders, I need to be able to reload both the model and input pipeline in order to resume training later. However, the make_initializer method of tf.contrib.data.Iterator does not have a name argument like most (all?) other Tensorflow operations, making it impossible (or at best, error-prone) to find these ops in the reloaded graph. Unless I'm mistaken, this seems like a standard use-case and the missing name argument is inconsistent with the rest of Tensorflow.

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

----==_mimepart_5988aa02f1656_43c73fc0fd359c303321b3--

I'm using tf.contrib.data for my input pipeline. Since it feeds the model without placeholders, I need to be able to reload both the model and input pipeline in order to resume training later. However, the make_initializer method of tf.contrib.data.Iterator does not have a name argument like most (all?) other Tensorflow operations, making it impossible (or at best, error-prone) to find these ops in the reloaded graph. Unless I'm mistaken, this seems like a standard use-case and the missing name argument is inconsistent with the rest of Tensorflow.
